description.string:
1) An introduction starting with discussion on the subject of superstitions. If students do not know the word teacher will translate it for them but they are asked to try to define the word in English and give some Polish examples
2 ) As a follow-up reading after a short introduction there will be PowerPoint presentation concerning superstitions in England (using learning resource) (Carol Sirila http://www.koolielu.ee/pages.php/03040..) Students watch the presentation, analyse new phrase and words, note them down, try to comprehend the main idea of it. To check if they understand a teacher can ask some questions at times. It is to make them understand what the subject is really about.
3) Reading task and developing reading skills. Students again read but this time a bigger text so as to be able to recognize the details concerning the subject of superstitions. (my own materials enclosed below the plan)
4) Analysing the same text: a) Matching the words with the pictures b) Finding the new words c) Explaining them according to the context d) Commenting on sentences (SS agree or not) e) Answering the questions c) Doing some follow-up exercises
6) Revising I conditional structures. Using them for creating sentences containing superstitions.(extra exercises on paper sheets used from a learning resource) http://scholaris.pl/cms/index.php/reso..
7) Homework: SS are asked to think about 10 Polish superstitions write them in meaningful context and illustrate them
